greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of Product_{j>=1} (1-j^(k*j)*x^j) in powers of x.
formula: A(0,k) = 1 and A(n,k) = -(1/n) * Sum_{j=1..n} (Sum_{d|j} d^(1+k*j)) * A(n-j,k) for n > 0.
mathematica: col[k_] := col[k] = CoefficientList[Product[(1 - j^(k*j)*x^j), {j, 1, rows + 3}] + O[x]^(rows + 3), x];
Table[A[n - k, k], {n, 0, rows - 1}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 10 2017 *)
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 06 2017
